member.name: T:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Actions.ActionBrowse
member.summary: This action is used as a security constraint that grants a user the ability to view nodes in a tree that has permissions applied to it.
member.remarks: This action should not be invoked. It is used as the minimum required permission to view nodes in the content tree. By granting a user this permission, the user is able to see the node in the tree but not edit the document. This may be used by other trees that support permissions in the future.

remarks.para: The runtime cache is the main application cache.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Cache.AppCaches.IsolatedCaches
member.summary: Gets the isolated caches.

remarks.para: Isolated caches are used by e.g. repositories, to ensure that each cached entity type has its own cache, so that lookups are fast and the repository does not need to search through all keys on a global scale.

member.name: T:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Composing.ComposeAfterAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a composer requires another composer.

remarks.para: This attribute is *not* inherited. This means that a composer class inheriting from another composer class does *not* inherit its requirements. However, the runtime checks the *interfaces* of every composer for their requirements, so requirements declared on interfaces are inherited by every composer class implementing the interface.
When targeting a class, indicates a dependency on the composer which must be enabled, unless the requirement has explicitly been declared as weak (and then, only if the composer is enabled).

When targeting an interface, indicates a dependency on enabled composers implementing the interface. It could be no composer at all, unless the requirement has explicitly been declared as strong (and at least one composer must be enabled).

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Composing.ComposeAfterAttribute.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The type of the required composer.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Composing.ComposeAfterAttribute.#ctor(System.Type,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The type of the required composer.
A value indicating whether the requirement is weak.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Composing.ComposeAfterAttribute.RequiredType
member.summary: Gets the required type.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Composing.ComposeAfterAttribute.Weak
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the requirement is weak.
member.remarks: Returns true if the requirement is weak (requires the other composer if it is enabled), false if the requirement is strong (requires the other composer to be enabled), and null if unspecified, in which case it is strong for classes and weak for interfaces.

member.name: T:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Composing.ComposeBeforeAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a component is required by another composer.

remarks.para: This attribute is *not* inherited. This means that a composer class inheriting from another composer class does *not* inherit its requirements. However, the runtime checks the *interfaces* of every composer for their requirements, so requirements declared on interfaces are inherited by every composer class implementing the interface.
When targeting a class, indicates a dependency on the composer which must be enabled, unless the requirement has explicitly been declared as weak (and then, only if the composer is enabled).

When targeting an interface, indicates a dependency on enabled composers implementing the interface. It could be no composer at all, unless the requirement has explicitly been declared as strong (and at least one composer must be enabled).

member.name: T:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Composing.DisableAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a composer should be disabled.

remarks.para: If a type is specified, disables the composer of that type, else disables the composer marked with the attribute.
This attribute is *not* inherited.
This attribute applies to classes only, it is not possible to enable/disable interfaces.

Assembly-level has greater priority than
attribute when it is marking the composer itself, but lower priority that when it is referencing another composer.

member.summary: Only install the default data specified in the

member.name: T:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.InstallDefaultDataSettings
member.summary: Typed configuration options for installation of default data.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.InstallDefaultDataSettings.InstallData
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to create default data on installation.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.InstallDefaultDataSettings.Values
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating which default data (languages, data types, etc.) should be created when is set to or .

remarks.para: For languages, the values provided should be the ISO codes for the languages to be included or excluded, e.g. "en-US". If removing the single default language, ensure that a different one is created via some other means (such as a restore from Umbraco Deploy schema data).

For data types, the values provided should be the Guid values used by Umbraco for the data type, listed at:
Some data types - such as the string label - cannot be excluded from install as they are required for core Umbraco functionality. Otherwise take care not to remove data types required for default Umbraco media and member types, unless you also choose to exclude them.

For media types, the values provided should be the Guid values used by Umbraco for the media type, listed at: https://github.com/umbraco/Umbraco-CMS/blob/v9/dev/src/Umbraco.Infrastructure/Migrations/Install/DatabaseDataCreator.cs.

For member types, the values provided should be the Guid values used by Umbraco for the member type, listed at: https://github.com/umbraco/Umbraco-CMS/blob/v9/dev/src/Umbraco.Infrastructure/Migrations/Install/DatabaseDataCreator.cs.

member.summary: Typed configuration options for models builder settings.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.ModelsBuilderSettings.ModelsMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value for the models mode.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.ModelsBuilderSettings.ModelsNamespace
member.summary: Gets or sets a value for models namespace.
member.remarks: That value could be overriden by other (attribute in user's code...). Return default if no value was supplied.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.ModelsBuilderSettings.FlagOutOfDateModels
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether we should flag out-of-date models.
member.remarks: Models become out-of-date when data types or content types are updated. When this setting is activated the ~/umbraco/models/PureLive/ood.txt file is then created. When models are generated through the dashboard, the files is cleared. Default value is false.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.ModelsBuilderSettings.ModelsDirectory
member.summary: Gets or sets a value for the models directory.
member.remarks: Default is ~/umbraco/models but that can be changed.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.ModelsBuilderSettings.AcceptUnsafeModelsDirectory
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to accept an unsafe value for ModelsDirectory.
member.remarks: An unsafe value is an absolute path, or a relative path pointing outside of the website root.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.ModelsBuilderSettings.DebugLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the debug log level.
member.remarks: 0 means minimal (safe on live site), anything else means more and more details (maybe not safe).

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.ModelsBuilderSettings.IncludeVersionNumberInGeneratedModels
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the version number should be included in generated models.
member.remarks: By default this is written to the output in generated code for each property of the model. This can be useful for debugging purposes but isn't essential, and it has the causes the generated code to change every time Umbraco is upgraded. In turn, this leads to unnecessary code file changes that need to be checked into source control. Default is true.

member.summary: Typed configuration options for package migration settings.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.PackageMigrationSettings.RunSchemaAndContentMigrations
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether package migration steps that install schema and content should run.
member.remarks: By default this is true and schema and content defined in a package migration are installed. Using configuration, administrators can optionally switch this off in certain environments. Deployment tools such as Umbraco Deploy can also configure this option to run or not run these migration steps as is appropriate for normal use of the tool.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.PackageMigrationSettings.AllowComponentOverrideOfRunSchemaAndContentMigrations
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether components can override the configured value for .
member.remarks: By default this is true and components can override the configured setting for . If an administrator wants explicit control over which environments migration steps installing schema and content can run, they can set this to false. Components should respect this and not override the configuration.

member.name: F:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.RuntimeMode.Development
member.summary: The development mode ensures the runtime is configured for rapidly applying changes.

member.name: F:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.RuntimeMode.Production
member.summary: The production mode ensures optimal performance settings are configured and denies any changes that would require recompilations.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.RuntimeSettings.TemporaryFileLifeTime

member.name: T:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.SecuritySettings
member.summary: Typed configuration options for security settings.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.SecuritySettings.KeepUserLoggedIn
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to keep the user logged in.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.SecuritySettings.HideDisabledUsersInBackOffice
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to hide disabled users in the back-office.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.SecuritySettings.AllowPasswordReset
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to allow user password reset.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.SecuritySettings.AuthCookieName
member.summary: Gets or sets a value for the authorization cookie name.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.SecuritySettings.AuthCookieDomain
member.summary: Gets or sets a value for the authorization cookie domain.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.SecuritySettings.UsernameIsEmail
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user's email address is to be considered as their username.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.SecuritySettings.MemberRequireUniqueEmail
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the member's email address must be unique.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.SecuritySettings.AllowedUserNameCharacters
member.summary: Gets or sets the set of allowed characters for a username

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.SecuritySettings.MemberBypassTwoFactorForExternalLogins
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to bypass the two factor requirement in Umbraco when using external login for members. Thereby rely on the External login and potential 2FA at that provider.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.SecuritySettings.UserBypassTwoFactorForExternalLogins
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to bypass the two factor requirement in Umbraco when using external login for users. Thereby rely on the External login and potential 2FA at that provider.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.SecuritySettings.MemberDefaultLockoutTimeInMinutes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value for how long (in minutes) a member is locked out when a lockout occurs.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.SecuritySettings.UserDefaultLockoutTimeInMinutes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value for how long (in minutes) a user is locked out when a lockout occurs.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.SecuritySettings.AllowConcurrentLogins
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to allow concurrent logins.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.SecuritySettings.UserDefaultFailedLoginDurationInMilliseconds
member.summary: Gets or sets the default duration (in milliseconds) of failed login attempts.
member.value: The default duration (in milliseconds) of failed login attempts.
member.remarks: The user login endpoint ensures that failed login attempts take at least as long as the average successful login. However, if no successful logins have occurred, this value is used as the default duration.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.SecuritySettings.UserMinimumFailedLoginDurationInMilliseconds
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum duration (in milliseconds) of failed login attempts.
member.value: The minimum duration (in milliseconds) of failed login attempts.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.SecuritySettings.BackOfficeHost
member.summary: Gets or sets a value of the back-office host URI. Use this when running the back-office client and the Management API on different hosts. Leave empty when running both on the same host.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.SecuritySettings.AuthorizeCallbackPathName
member.summary: Gets or sets the path to use for authorization callback. Will be appended to the BackOfficeHost.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.SecuritySettings.AuthorizeCallbackLogoutPathName
member.summary: Gets or sets the path to use for authorization callback logout. Will be appended to the BackOfficeHost.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.SecuritySettings.AuthorizeCallbackErrorPathName
member.summary: Gets or sets the path to use for authorization callback error. Will be appended to the BackOfficeHost.

member.name: T:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.SegmentSettings
member.summary: Typed configuration options for segment settings.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.SegmentSettings.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the usage of segments is enabled.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.SegmentSettings.AllowCreation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the creation of non-existing segments is allowed.

member.name: T:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.SecureSocketOptions
member.summary: Matches MailKit.Security.SecureSocketOptions and defined locally to avoid having to take a dependency on this external library into Umbraco.Core.

member.name: F:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.SecureSocketOptions.None
member.summary: No SSL or TLS encryption should be used.

member.name: F:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.SecureSocketOptions.Auto
member.summary: Allow the IMailService to decide which SSL or TLS options to use (default). If the server does not support SSL or TLS, then the connection will continue without any encryption.

member.name: F:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.SecureSocketOptions.SslOnConnect
member.summary: The connection should use SSL or TLS encryption immediately.

member.name: F:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.SecureSocketOptions.StartTls
member.summary: Elevates the connection to use TLS encryption immediately after reading the greeting and capabilities of the server. If the server does not support the STARTTLS extension, then the connection will fail and a NotSupportedException will be thrown.

member.name: F:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.SecureSocketOptions.StartTlsWhenAvailable
member.summary: Elevates the connection to use TLS encryption immediately after reading the greeting and capabilities of the server, but only if the server supports the STARTTLS extension.

member.summary: Typed configuration options for unattended settings.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.UnattendedSettings.InstallUnattended
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether unattended installs are enabled.

remarks.para: By default, when a database connection string is configured and it is possible to connect to the database, but the database is empty, the runtime enters the Install level. If this option is set to true an unattended install will be performed and the runtime enters the Run level.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.UnattendedSettings.UpgradeUnattended
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether unattended upgrades are enabled.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.UnattendedSettings.PackageMigrationsUnattended
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether unattended package migrations are enabled.
member.remarks: This is true by default.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value to use for creating a user with a name for Unattended Installs

member.summary: Gets or sets a value to use for creating a user with an email for Unattended Installs

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.UnattendedSettings.UnattendedUserPassword
member.summary: Gets or sets a value to use for creating a user with a password for Unattended Installs

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.WebhookSettings.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether webhooks are enabled.

remarks.para: By default, webhooks are enabled. If this option is set to false webhooks will no longer send web-requests.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.WebhookSettings.MaximumRetries
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the maximum number of retries for all webhooks.

remarks.para: By default, maximum number of retries is 5. If this option is set to 0 webhooks will no longer retry.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.WebhookSettings.Period
member.summary: Gets or sets a value for the period of the webhook firing.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.WebhookSettings.EnableLoggingCleanup
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether cleanup of webhook logs are enabled.

remarks.para: By default, cleanup is enabled.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.WebhookSettings.KeepLogsForDays
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating number of days to keep logs for.

remarks.para: By default, logs are kept for 30 days.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.WebhookSettings.PayloadType
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the type of payload used for sending webhooks

remarks.para: By default, Legacy payloads are used see for more info. This default will change to minimal starting from v17.

member.name: T:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.WebRoutingSettings
member.summary: Typed configuration options for web routing settings.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.WebRoutingSettings.TryMatchingEndpointsForAllPages
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to check if any routed endpoints match a front-end request before the Umbraco dynamic router tries to map the request to an Umbraco content item.
member.remarks: This should not be necessary if the Umbraco catch-all/dynamic route is registered last like it's supposed to be. In that case ASP.NET Core will automatically handle this in all cases. This is more of a backward compatible option since this is what v7/v8 used to do.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.WebRoutingSettings.TrySkipIisCustomErrors
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether IIS custom errors should be skipped.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.WebRoutingSettings.InternalRedirectPreservesTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether an internal redirect should preserve the template.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.WebRoutingSettings.DisableAlternativeTemplates
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the use of alternative templates are disabled.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.WebRoutingSettings.ValidateAlternativeTemplates
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the use of alternative templates should be validated.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.WebRoutingSettings.DisableRedirectUrlTracking
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether redirect URL tracking is disabled.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.WebRoutingSettings.UrlProviderMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value for the URL provider mode ().

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.Models.WebRoutingSettings.UmbracoApplicationUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets a value for the Umbraco application URL.

member.name: T:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.ModelsMode
member.summary: Defines the models generation modes.

member.name: F:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.ModelsMode.Nothing
member.summary: Do not generate strongly typed models.
member.remarks: This means that only IPublishedContent instances will be used.

member.name: F:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.ModelsMode.InMemoryAuto
member.summary: Generate models in memory. When: a content type change occurs.
member.remarks: The app does not restart. Models are available in views exclusively.

member.name: F:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.ModelsMode.SourceCodeManual
member.summary: Generate models as *.cs files. When: generation is triggered.
member.remarks: Generation can be triggered from the dashboard. The app does not restart. Models are not compiled and thus are not available to the project.

member.name: F:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.ModelsMode.SourceCodeAuto
member.summary: Generate models as *.cs files. When: a content type change occurs, or generation is triggered.
member.remarks: Generation can be triggered from the dashboard. The app does not restart. Models are not compiled and thus are not available to the project.

member.summary: Gets the non-semantic version of the Umbraco code.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.UmbracoVersion.Comment
member.summary: Gets the semantic version comments of the Umbraco code.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.UmbracoVersion.AssemblyVersion
member.summary: Gets the assembly version of the Umbraco code.

remarks.para: The assembly version is the value of the .
Is the one that the CLR checks for compatibility. Therefore, it changes only on hard-breaking changes (for instance, on new major versions).

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.UmbracoVersion.AssemblyFileVersion
member.summary: Gets the assembly file version of the Umbraco code.

remarks.para: The assembly version is the value of the .

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Configuration.UmbracoVersion.SemanticVersion
member.summary: Gets the semantic version of the Umbraco code.

remarks.para: The semantic version is the value of the .
It is the full version of Umbraco, including comments.

member.name: T:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Constants.ReferenceType
member.summary: Defines reference types.
member.remarks: Reference types are used to identify the type of entity that is being referenced when exposing references between Umbraco entities. These are used in the management API and backoffice to indicate and warn editors when working with an entity, as to what other entities depend on it. These consist of references managed by Umbraco relations (e.g. document, media and member). But also references that come from schema (e.g. data type usage on content types).

member.name: T:Umbraco.Cms.Core.DependencyInjection.StaticServiceProvider
member.summary: Service locator for internal (umbraco cms) only purposes. Should only be used if no other ways exist.
member.remarks: It is created with only two goals in mind 1) Continue to have the same extension methods on IPublishedContent and IPublishedElement as in V8. To make migration easier. 2) To have a tool to avoid breaking changes in minor and patch versions. All methods using this should in theory be obsolete. Keep in mind, every time this is used, the code becomes basically untestable.

member.name: T:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Deploy.IArtifact
member.summary: Represents an artifact ie an object that can be transfered between environments.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Deploy.IArtifact.Name
member.summary: Gets the name.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Deploy.IArtifact.Alias
member.summary: Gets the alias.

member.name: T:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Deploy.IArtifactSignature
member.summary: Represents the signature of an artifact.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Deploy.IArtifactSignature.Udi
member.summary: Gets the entity unique identifier of this artifact.

remarks.para: The project identifier is independent from the state of the artifact, its data values, dependencies, anything. It never changes and fully identifies the artifact.

What an entity uses as a unique identifier will influence what we can transfer between environments. Eg content type "Foo" on one environment is not necessarily the same as "Foo" on another environment, if guids are used as unique identifiers. What is used should be documented for each entity, along with the consequences of the choice.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Deploy.IArtifactSignature.Checksum
member.summary: Gets the checksum of this artifact.

remarks.para: The checksum depends on the artifact's properties, and on the identifiers of all its dependencies, but not on their checksums. So the checksum changes when any of the artifact's properties changes, or when the list of dependencies changes. But not if one of these dependencies change.

It is assumed that checksum collisions cannot happen ie that no two different artifact's states will ever produce the same checksum, so that if two artifacts have the same checksum then they are identical.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Deploy.IArtifactSignature.Dependencies
member.summary: Gets the dependencies of this artifact.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Deploy.IServiceConnector.GetRangeAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Gets a named range for specified entity type, identifier and selector.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains the named range for the specified entity type, identifier and selector.

remarks.para: This is temporary. At least we thought it would be, in sept. 2016. What day is it now?

At the moment our UI has a hard time returning proper UDIs, mainly because Core's tree do not manage GUIDs but only integers... so we have to provide a way to support it. The string id here can be either a real string (for string UDIs) or an "integer as a string", using the value "-1" to indicate the "root" i.e. an open UDI.

member.summary: Compares two artifacts.
member.param: A collection of differences to append to, if not null.
member.returns: A boolean value indicating whether the artifacts are identical.

member.name: T:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Deploy.IUniqueIdentifyingServiceConnector
member.summary: Provides a method to retrieve an artifact's unique identifier.
member.remarks: Artifacts are uniquely identified by their , however they represent elements in Umbraco that may be uniquely identified by another value. For example, a content type is uniquely identified by its alias. If someone creates a new content type, and tries to deploy it to a remote environment where a content type with the same alias already exists, both content types end up having different but the same alias. By default, Deploy would fail and throw when trying to save the new content type (duplicate alias). However, if the connector also implements this interface, the situation can be detected beforehand and reported in a nicer way.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Deploy.IUniqueIdentifyingServiceConnector.GetUniqueIdentifier(Umbraco.Cms.Core.Deploy.IArtifact)
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier of the specified artifact.

member.name: T:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Deploy.IValueConnector
member.summary: Defines methods that can convert a property value to and from an environment-agnostic string.
member.remarks: Property values may contain values such as content identifiers, that would be local to one environment and need to be converted in order to be deployed. Connectors also deal with serializing and deserializing the content value to an environment-agnostic string.

member.name: T:Umbraco.Cms.Core.DistributedLocking.IDistributedLockingMechanism
member.summary: Represents a class responsible for managing distributed locks.
member.remarks:
In general the rules for distributed locks are as follows.
Cannot obtain a write lock if a read lock exists for same lock id (except during an upgrade from reader -> writer)
Cannot obtain a write lock if a write lock exists for same lock id.
Cannot obtain a read lock if a write lock exists for same lock id.
Can obtain a read lock if a read lock exists for same lock id.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this distributed locking mechanism can be used.

member.remarks: When timeout is null, implementations should use .
member.exception: Failed to obtain distributed read lock in time.

member.summary: Obtains a distributed read lock.
member.remarks: When timeout is null, implementations should use .
member.exception: Failed to obtain distributed write lock in time.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Events.ServiceFactory
member.summary: A factory method used to resolve all services. For multiple instances, it will resolve against .

member.name: T:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Events.ServiceFactoryExtensions
member.summary: Extensions for .

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Events.ServiceFactoryExtensions.GetInstance``1(Umbraco.Cms.Core.Events.ServiceFactory)
member.summary: Gets an instance of .

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Events.ServiceFactoryExtensions.GetInstances``1(Umbraco.Cms.Core.Events.ServiceFactory)
member.summary: Gets a collection of instances of .
member.typeparam: The collection item type to return.

remarks.para:
Background - During v9 build we wanted an in-process message bus to facilitate removal of the old static event handlers.
Instead of taking a dependency on MediatR we (the community) implemented our own using MediatR as inspiration.

Some things worth knowing about MediatR.
All handlers are by default registered with transient lifetime, but can easily depend on services with state.
Both the Mediatr instance and its handler resolver are registered transient and as such it is always possible to depend on scoped services in a handler.

Our EventAggregator started out registered with a transient lifetime but later (before initial release) the registration was changed to singleton, presumably because there are a lot of singleton services in Umbraco which like to publish notifications and it's a pain to use scoped services from a singleton.
The problem with a singleton EventAggregator is it forces handlers to create a service scope and service locate any scoped services they wish to make use of e.g. a unit of work (think entity framework DBContext).

Moving forwards it probably makes more sense to register EventAggregator transient but doing so now would mean an awful lot of service location to avoid breaking changes.
For now we can do the next best thing which is to create a scope for each published notification, thus enabling the transient handlers to take a dependency on a scoped service.

Did discuss using HttpContextAccessor/IScopedServiceProvider to enable sharing of scopes when publisher has http context, but decided against because it's inconsistent with what happens in background threads and will just cause confusion.

member.remarks: See remarks on for explanation on what's going on with the IServiceProvider stuff here.

member.name: T:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Events.EventNameExtractor
member.summary: There is actually no way to discover an event name in c# at the time of raising the event. It is possible to get the event name from the handler that is being executed based on the event being raised, however that is not what we want in this case. We need to find the event name before it is being raised - you would think that it's possible with reflection or anything but that is not the case, the delegate that defines an event has no info attached to it, it is literally just an event. So what this does is take the sender and event args objects, looks up all public/static events on the sender that have a generic event handler with generic arguments (but only) one, then we match the type of event arguments with the ones being passed in. As it turns out, in our services this will work for the majority of our events! In some cases it may not work and we'll have to supply a string but hopefully this saves a bit of magic strings. We can also write tests to validate these are all working correctly for all services.

member.name: T:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Events.IEventDispatcher
member.summary: Dispatches events from within a scope.

remarks.para: The name of the event is auto-magically discovered by matching the sender type, args type, and eventHandler type. If the match is not unique, then the name parameter must be used to specify the name in an explicit way.
What happens when an event is dispatched depends on the scope settings. It can be anything from "trigger immediately" to "just ignore". Refer to the scope documentation for more details.

member.name: T:Umbraco.Cms.Core.HashCodeCombiner
member.summary: Used to create a .NET HashCode from multiple objects.
member.remarks: .Net has a class the same as this: System.Web.Util.HashCodeCombiner and of course it works for all sorts of things which we've not included here as we just need a quick easy class for this in order to create a unique hash of directories/files to see if they have changed. NOTE: It's probably best to not relying on the hashing result across AppDomains! If you need a constant/reliable hash value between AppDomains use SHA1. This is perfect for hashing things in a very fast way for a single AppDomain.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.HashCodeCombiner.GetCombinedHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hex code of the combined hash code

member.name: T:Umbraco.Cms.Core.HashCodeHelper
member.summary: Borrowed from http://stackoverflow.com/a/2575444/694494

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.HashCodeHelper.GetHashCodeForOrderNoMatterCollection``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0})
member.summary: Gets a hashcode for a collection for that the order of items does not matter. So {1, 2, 3} and {3, 2, 1} will get same hash code.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.HashCodeHelper.CombineHashCode``1(System.Int32,``0)
member.summary:
Alternative way to get a hashcode is to use a fluent interface like this:
return 0.CombineHashCode(field1).CombineHashCode(field2). CombineHashCode(field3);

member.name: T:Umbraco.Cms.Core.HashGenerator
member.summary: Used to generate a string hash using crypto libraries over multiple objects
member.remarks: This should be used to generate a reliable hash that survives AppDomain restarts. This will use the crypto libs to generate the hash and will try to ensure that strings, etc... are not re-allocated so it's not consuming much memory.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.HashGenerator.GenerateHash
member.summary: Returns the generated hash output of all added objects

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Hosting.HostingEnvironmentExtensions.GetBackOfficePath(Umbraco.Cms.Core.Hosting.IHostingEnvironment)
member.summary: Gets the absolute URL path of the back office.
member.returns: The absolute URL path of the back office.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Hosting.IHostingEnvironment.ApplicationId
member.summary: The unique application ID for this Umbraco website.

remarks.para: The returned value will be the same consistent value for an Umbraco website on a specific server and will the same between restarts of that Umbraco website/application on that specific server.

The value of this does not distinguish between unique workers/servers for this Umbraco application. Usage of this must take into account that the same may be returned for the same Umbraco website hosted on different servers.
Similarly the usage of this must take into account that a different may be returned for the same Umbraco website hosted on different servers.

This returns a hash of the value of IApplicationDiscriminator.Discriminator (which is most likely just the value of unless an alternative implementation of IApplicationDiscriminator has been registered).
However during ConfigureServices a temporary instance of IHostingEnvironment is constructed which guarantees that this will be the hash of , so the value may differ depend on when the property is used.
If you require this value during ConfigureServices it is probably a code smell.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Hosting.IHostingEnvironment.ApplicationPhysicalPath
member.summary: Will return the physical path to the root of the application

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Hosting.IHostingEnvironment.ApplicationVirtualPath
member.summary: The web application's hosted path
member.remarks: In most cases this will return "/" but if the site is hosted in a virtual directory then this will return the virtual directory's path such as "/mysite". This value must begin with a "/" and cannot end with "/".

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Hosting.IHostingEnvironment.IsHosted
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether Umbraco is hosted.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Hosting.IHostingEnvironment.ApplicationMainUrl
member.summary: Gets the main application url.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Hosting.IHostingEnvironment.MapPathWebRoot(System.String)
member.summary: Maps a virtual path to a physical path to the application's web root
member.remarks: Depending on the runtime 'web root', this result can vary. For example in Net Framework the web root and the content root are the same, however in netcore the web root is /www therefore this will Map to a physical path within www.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Hosting.IHostingEnvironment.MapPathContentRoot(System.String)
member.summary: Maps a virtual path to a physical path to the application's root (not always equal to the web root)
member.remarks: Depending on the runtime 'web root', this result can vary. For example in Net Framework the web root and the content root are the same, however in netcore the web root is /www therefore this will Map to a physical path within www.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Hosting.IHostingEnvironment.ToAbsolute(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a virtual path to an absolute URL path based on the application's web root
member.param: The virtual path. Must start with either ~/ or / else an exception is thrown.
member.remarks: This maps the virtual path syntax to the web root. For example when hosting in a virtual directory called "site" and the value "~/pages/test" is passed in, it will map to "/site/pages/test" where "/site" is the value of .
member.exception: If virtualPath does not start with ~/ or /

member.summary: Ensures that the application know its main Url.

remarks.para: The file is considered "owned" by the content/propertyType.

member.name: T:Umbraco.Cms.Core.IO.MediaPathSchemes.UniqueMediaPathScheme
member.summary: Implements a unique directory media path scheme.

remarks.para: This scheme provides deterministic short paths, with potential collisions.

Returning null so that does *not* delete any directory. This is because the above shortening of the Guid to 8 chars means we're increasing the risk of collision, and we don't want to delete files belonging to other media items.
And, at the moment, we cannot delete directory "only if it is empty" because of race conditions. We'd need to implement locks in for this.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Logging.LoggingTaskExtension.LogErrors(System.Threading.Tasks.Task,System.Action{System.String,System.Exception})
member.summary: This task shouldn't be waited on (as it's not guaranteed to run), and you shouldn't wait on the parent task either (because it might throw an exception that doesn't get handled). If you want to be waiting on something, use LogErrorsWaitable instead. None of these methods are suitable for tasks that return a value. If you're wanting a result, you should probably be handling errors yourself.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Logging.LoggingTaskExtension.LogErrorsWaitable(System.Threading.Tasks.Task,System.Action{System.String,System.Exception})
member.summary: This task can be waited on (as it's guaranteed to run), and you should wait on this rather than the parent task. Because it's guaranteed to run, it may be slower than using LogErrors, and you should consider using that method if you don't want to wait. None of these methods are suitable for tasks that return a value. If you're wanting a result, you should probably be handling errors yourself.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.ContentTypeBase.SupportsPublishing
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the content type supports publishing.

remarks.para: A publishing content type supports draft and published values for properties. It is possible to retrieve either the draft (default) or published value of a property. Setting the value always sets the draft value, which then needs to be published.
A non-publishing content type only supports one value for properties. Getting the draft or published value of a property returns the same thing, and publishing a value property has no effect.

member.name: T:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.ContentTypeEditing.ContentTypeEditingModelBase`2
member.summary:
This is the common model for all content types, Documents, Media, Members. All the properties are common across all content types. Additionally most properties of the property types are shared as well.
To allow for common validation and such, the property types are required to inherit from the same base. The same goes for the property type containers. (I.E Tabs and Groups)
member.typeparam: The type of the property types, I.E .
The type of the content type containers, I.E .

member.summary: Gets the published cultures.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.IContent.EditedCultures
member.summary: Gets the edited cultures.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.IContent.IsCulturePublished(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a culture is published.

remarks.para: A culture becomes published whenever values for this culture are published, and the content published name for this culture is non-null. It becomes non-published whenever values for this culture are unpublished.
A culture becomes published as soon as PublishCulture has been invoked, even though the document might not have been saved yet (and can have no identity).
Does not support the '*' wildcard (returns false).

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.IContent.GetPublishDate(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the date a culture was published.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.IContent.IsCultureEdited(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a value indicated whether a given culture is edited.

remarks.para: A culture is edited when it is available, and not published or published but with changes.
A culture can be edited even though the document might now have been saved yet (and can have no identity).
Does not support the '*' wildcard (returns false).

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.IContent.GetPublishName(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the name of the published version of the content for a given culture.

remarks.para: When editing the content, the name can change, but this will not until the content is published.
When is null, gets the invariant language, which is the value of the property.

member.summary: Sets the name of the content item for a specified culture.

When is not null, throws if the content type does not vary by culture.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.IContentBase.GetCultureName(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the name of the content item for a specified language.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.IContentBase.IsCultureAvailable(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a given culture is available.

remarks.para: A culture becomes available whenever the content name for this culture is non-null, and it becomes unavailable whenever the content name is null.
Returns false for the invariant culture, in order to be consistent with , even though the invariant culture is always available.
Does not support the '*' wildcard (returns false).

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.IContentBase.GetUpdateDate(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the date a culture was updated.

remarks.para: When is null, returns null.
If the specified culture is not available, returns null.

member.name: T:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.IContentModel
member.summary: The basic view model returned for front-end Umbraco controllers

remarks.para: exists in order to unify all view models in Umbraco, whether it's a normal template view or a user's custom model that they have created when doing route hijacking or custom routes.

By default all front-end template views inherit from UmbracoViewPage which has a model of but the model returned from the controllers is which in normal circumstances would not work. This works with UmbracoViewPage because it performs model binding between IContentModel and IPublishedContent. This offers a lot of flexibility when rendering views. In some cases if you are route hijacking and returning a custom implementation of and your view is strongly typed to this model, you can still render partial views created in the back office that have the default model of IPublishedContent without having to worry about explicitly passing that model to the view.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.IContentTypeBase.SupportsVariation(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Validates that a combination of culture and segment is valid for the content type.
member.param: A value indicating whether wildcard are supported.
member.returns: True if the combination is valid; otherwise false.

remarks.para: The combination must match the content type variation exactly. For instance, if the content type varies by culture, then an invariant culture would be invalid.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.IContentTypeBase.SupportsPropertyVariation(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Validates that a combination of culture and segment is valid for the content type properties.
member.param: A value indicating whether wildcard are supported.
member.returns: True if the combination is valid; otherwise false.

remarks.para: The combination must be valid for properties of the content type. For instance, if the content type varies by culture, then an invariant culture is valid, because some properties may be invariant. On the other hand, if the content type is invariant, then a variant culture is invalid, because no property could possibly vary by culture.

member.name: F:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.ImageCropMode.Crop
member.summary: Resizes the image to the given dimensions. If the set dimensions do not match the aspect ratio of the original image then the output is cropped to match the new aspect ratio.

member.name: F:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.ImageCropMode.Max
member.summary: Resizes the image to the given dimensions. If the set dimensions do not match the aspect ratio of the original image then the output is resized to the maximum possible value in each direction while maintaining the original aspect ratio.

member.name: F:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.ImageCropMode.Stretch
member.summary: Resizes the image to the given dimensions. If the set dimensions do not match the aspect ratio of the original image then the output is stretched to match the new aspect ratio.

member.name: F:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.ImageCropMode.Pad
member.summary: Passing a single dimension will automatically preserve the aspect ratio of the original image. If the requested aspect ratio is different then the image will be padded to fit.

member.name: F:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.ImageCropMode.BoxPad
member.summary: When upscaling an image the image pixels themselves are not resized, rather the image is padded to fit the given dimensions.

member.name: F:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.ImageCropMode.Min
member.summary: Resizes the image until the shortest side reaches the set given dimension. This will maintain the aspect ratio of the original image. Upscaling is disabled in this mode and the original image will be returned if attempted.

member.name: T:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.ImageUrlGenerationOptions

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.ISimpleContentType.SupportsPropertyVariation(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Validates that a combination of culture and segment is valid for the content type properties.
member.param: A value indicating whether wildcard are supported.
member.returns: True if the combination is valid; otherwise false.

remarks.para: The combination must be valid for properties of the content type. For instance, if the content type varies by culture, then an invariant culture is valid, because some properties may be invariant. On the other hand, if the content type is invariant, then a variant culture is invalid, because no property could possibly vary by culture.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.PropertyType.SupportsPublishing
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the content type owning this property type is publishing.

remarks.para: A publishing content type supports draft and published values for properties. It is possible to retrieve either the draft (default) or published value of a property. Setting the value always sets the draft value, which then needs to be published.
A non-publishing content type only supports one value for properties. Getting the draft or published value of a property returns the same thing, and publishing a value property has no effect.
When true, getting the property value returns the edited value by default, but it is possible to get the published value using the appropriate 'published' method parameter.
When false, getting the property value always return the edited value, regardless of the 'published' method parameter.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.PublishedContent.IPublishedContent.IsDraft(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the content is draft.

remarks.para: A content is draft when it is the unpublished version of a content, which may have a published version, or not.

When retrieving documents from cache in non-preview mode, IsDraft is always false, as only published documents are returned. When retrieving in preview mode, IsDraft can either be true (document is not published, or has been edited, and what is returned is the edited version) or false (document is published, and has not been edited, and what is returned is the published version).

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.PublishedContent.IPublishedContent.IsPublished(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the content is published.

remarks.para: A content is published when it has a published version.

When retrieving documents from cache in non-preview mode, IsPublished is always true, as only published documents are returned. When retrieving in draft mode, IsPublished can either be true (document has a published version) or false (document has no published version).
It is therefore possible for both IsDraft and IsPublished to be true at the same time, meaning that the content is the draft version, and a published version exists.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.PublishedContent.IPublishedProperty.HasValue(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the property has a value.

remarks.para: This is somewhat implementation-dependent -- depending on whatever IPublishedCache considers a missing value.
The XmlPublishedCache raw values are strings, and it will consider missing, null or empty (and that includes whitespace-only) strings as "no value".
Other caches that get their raw value from the database would consider that a property has "no value" if it is missing, null, or an empty string (including whitespace-only).

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.PublishedContent.IPublishedProperty.GetSourceValue(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the source value of the property.

remarks.para: The source value is whatever was passed to the property when it was instantiated, and it is somewhat implementation-dependent -- depending on how the IPublishedCache is implemented.
The XmlPublishedCache source values are strings exclusively since they come from the Xml cache.
For other caches that get their source value from the database, it would be either a string, an integer (Int32), a date and time (DateTime) or a decimal (double).
If you're using that value, you're probably wrong, unless you're doing some internal Umbraco stuff.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.PublishedContent.IPublishedProperty.GetValue(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the object value of the property.

remarks.para: The value is what you want to use when rendering content in an MVC view ie in C#.
It can be null, or any type of CLR object.
It has been fully prepared and processed by the appropriate converter.

member.name: T:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.PublishedContent.IPublishedValueFallback
member.summary: Provides a fallback strategy for getting values.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.PublishedContent.IPublishedValueFallback.TryGetValue(Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.PublishedContent.IPublishedProperty,System.String,System.String,Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.PublishedContent.Fallback,System.Object,System.Object@)
member.summary: Tries to get a fallback value for a property.
member.returns: A value indicating whether a fallback value could be provided.

remarks.para: This method is called whenever property.Value(culture, segment, defaultValue) is called, and property.HasValue(culture, segment) is false.
It can only fallback at property level (no recurse).
At property level, property.GetValue() does *not* implement fallback, and one has to get property.Value() or property.Value{T}() to trigger fallback.
Note that and may not be contextualized, so the variant context should be used to contextualize them (see our default implementation in the web project.

member.summary: Tries to get a fallback value for a published content property.
member.param: The property that does not have a value.
member.returns: A value indicating whether a fallback value could be provided.

remarks.para: This method is called whenever getting the property value for the specified alias, culture and segment, either returned no property at all, or a property with HasValue(culture, segment) being false.

In an , because walking up the tree is possible, the content itself may not even have a property with the specified alias, but such a property may exist up in the tree. The
parameter is used to return a property with no value. That can then be used to invoke a converter and get the converter's interpretation of "no value".

member.name: T:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.Validation.RequiredForPersistenceAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that a data field value is required in order to persist an object.

remarks.para:
There are two levels of validation in Umbraco. (1) value validation is performed by
instances; it can prevent a content item from being published, but not from being saved. (2) required validation of properties marked with ; it does prevent an object from being saved and is used for properties that are absolutely mandatory, such as the name of a content item.

member.summary: Represents a data editor.

member.summary: Gets or sets an explicit value editor.
member.remarks: Used for manifest data editors.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.PropertyEditors.DataEditor.Attribute
member.summary: Gets the editor attribute.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.PropertyEditors.DataEditor.ExplicitConfigurationEditor
member.summary: Gets or sets an explicit configuration editor.
member.remarks: Used for manifest data editors.

remarks.para: If an explicit value editor has been assigned, then this explicit instance is returned. Otherwise, a new instance is created by CreateValueEditor.
The instance created by CreateValueEditor is cached if allowed by the DataEditor attribute ( == true).
If an explicit value editor has been assigned, then this explicit instance is returned. Otherwise, a new instance is created by CreateValueEditor, and configured with the configuration.

The instance created by CreateValueEditor is not cached, i.e. a new instance is created each time the property value is retrieved. The property editor is a singleton, and the value editor cannot be a singleton since it depends on the datatype configuration.
Technically, it could be cached by datatype but let's keep things simple enough for now.
If an explicit configuration editor has been assigned, then this explicit instance is returned. Otherwise, a new instance is created by CreateConfigurationEditor.

The instance created by CreateConfigurationEditor is not cached, i.e. a new instance is created each time. The property editor is a singleton, and although the configuration editor could technically be a singleton too, we'd rather not keep configuration editor cached.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.PropertyEditors.DataValueEditor.FromEditor(Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.Editors.ContentPropertyData,System.Object)
member.summary: A method to deserialize the string value that has been saved in the content editor to an object to be stored in the database.
member.param: The value returned by the editor.

The current value that has been persisted to the database for this editor. This value may be useful for how the value then get's deserialized again to be re-persisted. In most cases it will probably not be used.
member.returns: The value that gets persisted to the database.
member.remarks: By default this will attempt to automatically convert the string value to the value type supplied by ValueType. If overridden then the object returned must match the type supplied in the ValueType, otherwise persisting the value to the DB will fail when it tries to validate the value type.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.PropertyEditors.DataValueEditor.ToEditor(Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.IProperty,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: A method used to format the database value to a value that can be used by the editor.
member.exception: ValueType was out of range.
member.remarks: The object returned will automatically be serialized into JSON notation. For most property editors the value returned is probably just a string, but in some cases a JSON structure will be returned.

member.summary: Converts a property to Xml fragments.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.PropertyEditors.DataValueEditor.ConvertDbToXml(Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.IPropertyType,System.Object)
member.summary: Converts a property value to an Xml fragment.

remarks.para: By default, this returns the value of ConvertDbToString but ensures that if the db value type is NVarchar or NText, the value is returned as a CDATA fragment - else it's a Text fragment.
Returns an XText or XCData instance which must be wrapped in a element.
If the value is empty we will not return as CDATA since that will just take up more space in the file.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.PropertyEditors.DefaultPropertyValueConverterAttribute.DefaultConvertersToShadow
member.summary: A DefaultPropertyValueConverter can 'shadow' other default property value converters so that a DefaultPropertyValueConverter can be more specific than another one.
member.remarks: An example where this is useful is that both the MultiUrlPickerValueConverter and the JsonValueConverter will be returned as value converters for the Related Links Property editor, however the JsonValueConverter is a very generic converter and the MultiUrlPickerValueConverter is more specific than it, so the MultiUrlPickerValueConverter can specify that it 'shadows' the JsonValueConverter.

member.summary: Gets the type of values returned by the converter for Delivery API representation.
member.returns: The CLR type of values returned by the converter.
member.remarks: Some of the CLR types may be generated, therefore this method cannot directly return a Type object (which may not exist yet). In which case it needs to return a ModelType instance.

member.summary: Converts a property intermediate value to an Object value for Delivery API representation.
member.param: The property set owning the property.
A value indicating whether conversion should take place in preview mode.
A value indicating whether the property value should be expanded (if applicable).

remarks.para: The converter should know how to convert a null intermediate value, or any intermediate value indicating that no value has been assigned to the property. It is up to the converter to determine what to return in that case: either null, or the default value...

The is passed to the converter so that it can be, in turn, passed to eg a PublishedFragment constructor. It is used by the fragment and the properties to manage the cache levels of property values. It is not meant to be used by the converter.

member.name: T:Umbraco.Cms.Core.PropertyEditors.IPropertyIndexValueFactory
member.summary: Represents a property index value factory.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.PropertyEditors.IPropertyIndexValueFactory.GetIndexValues(Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.IProperty,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.Guid,Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.IContentType})
member.summary: Gets the index values for a property.

remarks.para: Returns index values for a given property. By default, a property uses its alias as index field name, and there would be only one index value, but some implementations (see for instance the grid one) may return more than one value, with different indexed field names.

And then, values are an enumerable of objects, because each indexed field can in turn have multiple values. By default, there would be only one object: the property value. But some implementations may return more than one value for a given field.

member.remarks: This is not a simple "value converter" because it really works only for properties.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the converter supports a property type.
member.returns: A value indicating whether the converter supports a property type.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.PropertyEditors.IPropertyValueConverter.IsValue(System.Object,Umbraco.Cms.Core.PropertyEditors.PropertyValueLevel)
member.summary: Determines whether a value is an actual value, or not a value.

remarks.para: Called for Source, Inter and Object levels, until one does not return null.

Can return true (is a value), false (is not a value), or null to indicate that it cannot be determined at the specified level. For instance, if source is a string that could contain JSON, the decision could be made on the intermediate value. Or, if it is a picker, it could be made on the object value (the actual picked object).

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.PropertyEditors.IPropertyValueConverter.GetPropertyValueType(Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.PublishedContent.IPublishedPropertyType)
member.summary: Gets the type of values returned by the converter.
member.returns: The CLR type of values returned by the converter.
member.remarks: Some of the CLR types may be generated, therefore this method cannot directly return a Type object (which may not exist yet). In which case it needs to return a ModelType instance.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.PropertyEditors.IPropertyValueConverter.GetPropertyCacheLevel(Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.PublishedContent.IPublishedPropertyType)
member.summary: Gets the property cache level.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.PropertyEditors.IPropertyValueConverter.ConvertSourceToIntermediate(Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.PublishedContent.IPublishedElement,Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.PublishedContent.IPublishedPropertyType,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts a property source value to an intermediate value.
member.param: The property set owning the property.
A value indicating whether conversion should take place in preview mode.

remarks.para: The converter should know how to convert a null source value, meaning that no value has been assigned to the property. The intermediate value can be null.
With the XML cache, source values come from the XML cache and therefore are strings.
With objects caches, source values would come from the database and therefore be either ints, DateTimes, decimals, or strings.
The converter should be prepared to handle both situations.
When source values are strings, the converter must handle empty strings, whitespace strings, and xml-whitespace strings appropriately, ie it should know whether to preserve white spaces.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.PropertyEditors.IPropertyValueConverter.ConvertIntermediateToObject(Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.PublishedContent.IPublishedElement,Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.PublishedContent.IPublishedPropertyType,Umbraco.Cms.Core.PropertyEditors.PropertyCacheLevel,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts a property intermediate value to an Object value.
member.param: The property set owning the property.
A value indicating whether conversion should take place in preview mode.

remarks.para: The converter should know how to convert a null intermediate value, or any intermediate value indicating that no value has been assigned to the property. It is up to the converter to determine what to return in that case: either null, or the default value...

The is passed to the converter so that it can be, in turn, passed to eg a PublishedFragment constructor. It is used by the fragment and the properties to manage the cache levels of property values. It is not meant to be used by the converter.

member.name: T:Umbraco.Cms.Core.PropertyEditors.ValueConverters.LabelValueConverter
member.summary: We need this property converter so that we always force the value of a label to be a string
member.remarks: Without a property converter defined for the label type, the value will be converted with the `ConvertUsingDarkMagic` method which will try to parse the value into it's correct type, but this can cause issues if the string is detected as a number and then strips leading zeros. Example: http://issues.umbraco.org/issue/U4-7929

member.name: T:Umbraco.Cms.Core.PropertyEditors.ValueConverters.MustBeStringValueConverter
member.summary: Ensures that no matter what is selected in (editor), the value results in a string.

remarks.para: For more details see issues http://issues.umbraco.org/issue/U4-3776 (MNTP) and http://issues.umbraco.org/issue/U4-4160 (media picker).

The cache level is set to .Content because the string is supposed to depend on the source value only, and not on any other content. It is NOT appropriate to use that converter for values whose .ToString() would depend on other content.

member.summary: Emits a constructor.
member.param: A value indicating whether the constructor must exist.
The optional type of the class to construct.
member.returns: A constructor function. If is false, returns null when the constructor does not exist.

remarks.para: When is not specified, it is the type returned by .
The constructor arguments are determined by generic arguments.
The type returned by does not need to be exactly , when e.g. that type is not known at compile time, but it has to be a parent type (eg an interface, or object).

member.exception: Occurs when the constructor does not exist and is true.
Occurs when is not a Func or when is specified and does not match the function's returned type.

member.summary: Emits a constructor.

member.name: T:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Routing.ContentFinderByUrlAndTemplate
member.summary: Provides an implementation of that handles page nice URLs and a template.

remarks.para: This finder allows for an odd routing pattern similar to altTemplate, probably only use case is if there is an alternative mime type template and it should be routable by something like "/hello/world/json" where the JSON template is to be used for the "world" page
Handles /foo/bar/template where /foo/bar is the nice URL of a document, and template a template alias.
If successful, then the template of the document request is also assigned.

member.summary: Provides utilities to handle domains.
Gets the culture assigned to a document by domains, in the context of a current Uri.
member.returns: The culture assigned to the document by domains.

remarks.para: In 1:1 multilingual setup, a document contains several cultures (there is not one document per culture), and domains, withing the context of a current Uri, assign a culture to that document.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Routing.DomainUtilities.DomainForNode(Umbraco.Cms.Core.PublishedCache.IDomainCache,Umbraco.Cms.Core.Routing.ISiteDomainMapper,System.Int32,System.Uri,System.String)
member.summary: Finds the domain for the specified node, if any, that best matches a specified uri.
member.returns: The domain and its uri, if any, that best matches the specified uri and culture, else null.

remarks.para: If at least a domain is set on the node then the method returns the domain that best matches the specified uri and culture, else it returns null.
If culture is null, uses the default culture for the installation instead. Otherwise, will try with the specified culture, else return null.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Routing.DomainUtilities.DomainsForNode(Umbraco.Cms.Core.PublishedCache.IDomainCache,Umbraco.Cms.Core.Routing.ISiteDomainMapper,System.Int32,System.Uri,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Find the domains for the specified node, if any, that match a specified uri.
member.param: A value indicating whether to exclude the current/default domain. True by default.
member.returns: The domains and their uris, that match the specified uri, else null.
member.remarks: If at least a domain is set on the node then the method returns the domains that best match the specified uri, else it returns null.

member.summary: Selects the domain that best matches a specified uri and cultures, from a set of domains.
member.param: An optional function to filter the list of domains, if more than one applies.
member.returns: The domain and its normalized uri, that best matches the specified uri and cultures.
member.remarks:
TODO: must document and explain this all
If is null, pick the first domain that matches , else the first that matches , else the first one (ordered by id), else null.
If is not null, look for domains that would be a base uri of the current uri,
If more than one domain matches, then the function is used to pick the right one, unless it is null, in which case the method returns null.
The filter, if any, will be called only with a non-empty argument, and _must_ return something.

member.summary: Gets the URL of a media item.
member.param: The property alias to resolve the URL from.

remarks.para: The URL is absolute or relative depending on mode and on current.
If the media is multi-lingual, gets the URL for the specified culture or, when no culture is specified, the current culture.
The URL provider can ignore the mode and always return an absolute URL, e.g. a cdn URL provider will most likely always return an absolute URL.
If the provider is unable to provide a URL, it returns null.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the Umbraco Backoffice should ignore a collision for this request.

remarks.para: This is an uncommon API used for edge cases with complex routing and would be used by developers to configure the request to disable collision checks in .

This flag is based on previous Umbraco versions but it is not clear how this flag can be set by developers since collission checking only occurs in the back office which is launched by
for which events do not execute.
More can be read about this setting here: https://github.com/umbraco/Umbraco-CMS/pull/2148, https://issues.umbraco.org/issue/U4-10345 but it's still unclear how this was used.

member.summary: Creates a published request.

member.summary: Sends a through the routing pipeline and builds a result.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Routing.IPublishedRouter.UpdateRequestAsync(Umbraco.Cms.Core.Routing.IPublishedRequest,Umbraco.Cms.Core.Models.PublishedContent.IPublishedContent)
member.summary: Updates the request to use the specified item, or NULL

remarks.returns: A new based on values from the original and with the re-routed values based on the passed in
remarks.para: This method is used for 2 cases: - When the rendering content needs to change due to Public Access rules. - When there is nothing to render due to circumstances such as no template files. In this case, NULL is used as the parameter.

This method is invoked when the pipeline decides it cannot render the request, for whatever reason, and wants to force it to be re-routed and rendered as if no document were found (404). This occurs if there is no template found and route hijacking was not matched. In that case it's the same as if there was no content which means even if there was content matched we want to run the request through the last chance finders.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Routing.IPublishedRouter.RouteDomain(Umbraco.Cms.Core.Routing.IPublishedRequestBuilder)
member.summary:
Finds the site root (if any) matching the http request, and updates the PublishedRequest and VariationContext accordingly.
This method is used for VirtualPage routing.
In this case we do not want to run the entire routing pipeline since ContentFinders are not needed here. However, we do want to set the culture on VariationContext and PublishedRequest to the values specified by the domains.
member.param: The request to update the culture on domain on
member.returns: True if a domain was found otherwise false.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Routing.IPublishedRouter.UpdateVariationContext(System.Uri)
member.summary: Finds the site root (if any) matching the http request, and updates the VariationContext accordingly.

remarks.para: This is used for VirtualPage routing.

This is required to set the culture on VariationContext to the values specified by the domains, before the FindContent method is called. In order to allow the FindContent implementer to correctly find content based off the culture. Before the PublishedRequest is built.

member.param: The URI to resolve the domain from.
member.returns: True if a domain was found, otherwise false.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Routing.PublishedRequestOld.IsInitialPublishedContent
member.summary: Gets value indicating whether the current published content is the initial one.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Routing.PublishedRequestOld.SetIsInitialPublishedContent
member.summary: Indicates that the current PublishedContent is the initial one.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Routing.PublishedRequestOld.IsInternalRedirectPublishedContent
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the current published content has been obtained from the initial published content following internal redirections exclusively.
member.remarks: Used by PublishedContentRequestEngine.FindTemplate() to figure out whether to apply the internal redirect or not, when content is not the initial content.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Routing.PublishedRequestOld.Is404
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the requested content could not be found.
member.remarks: This is set in the PublishedContentRequestBuilder and can also be used in custom content finders or Prepared event handlers, where we want to allow developers to indicate a request is 404 but not to cancel it.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Routing.PublishedRequestOld.IsRedirect
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the content request triggers a redirect (permanent or not).

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Routing.PublishedRequestOld.IsRedirectPermanent
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the redirect is permanent.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Routing.PublishedRequestOld.RedirectUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL to redirect to, when the content request triggers a redirect.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Routing.PublishedRequestOld.SetRedirect(System.String)
member.summary: Indicates that the content request should trigger a redirect (302).
member.remarks: Does not actually perform a redirect, only registers that the response should redirect. Redirect will or will not take place in due time.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Routing.PublishedRequestOld.SetRedirectPermanent(System.String)
member.summary: Indicates that the content request should trigger a permanent redirect (301).
member.remarks: Does not actually perform a redirect, only registers that the response should redirect. Redirect will or will not take place in due time.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Routing.PublishedRequestOld.SetRedirect(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Indicates that the content request should trigger a redirect, with a specified status code.
member.remarks: Does not actually perform a redirect, only registers that the response should redirect. Redirect will or will not take place in due time.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Routing.PublishedRequestOld.ResponseStatusCode
member.summary: Gets or sets the content request http response status code.
member.remarks: Does not actually set the http response status code, only registers that the response should use the specified code. The code will or will not be used, in due time.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Routing.PublishedRequestOld.ResponseStatusDescription
member.summary: Gets or sets the content request http response status description.
member.remarks: Does not actually set the http response status description, only registers that the response should use the specified description. The description will or will not be used, in due time.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Cms.Core.Routing.PublishedRequestOld.SetResponseStatus(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the http response status code, along with an optional associated description.
member.remarks: Does not actually set the http response status code and description, only registers that the response should use the specified code and description. The code and description will or will not be used, in due time.
